title: The Ripple and the shed
subject_group: Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/Boats and boating - Safety measures
abstract: The painstaking process of preserving the rich history of Inverloch for visitors and future generations. Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Bass Coast'.
description: Inverloch’s Clock Tower Committee and Historical Society, in south-eastern Victoria, joined forces to create a maritime precinct along the town’s foreshore. The lovingly restored ‘Rocket Shed’ and newly built replica of ‘The Ripple’ sit side-by-side and showcase Inverloch’s connection to the water. ‘The Ripple’ is responsible for delivering timber for the first house built in Inverloch and the ‘Rocket Shed’ tells the story of a time when ocean rescues were less sophisticated than recent times.
